subject: Communication
title: Building Global Communication Competence
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Building Global Communication Competence.

hook.text: You can speak five languages and still fail at cross-cultural communication. Language is just the surface layer.

buildup.text: Intercultural competence has three pillars: knowledge (cultural facts), skills (adaptation), and attitudes (openness).

discovery.text: Milton Bennett's model: from denial to integration, people move through stages of intercultural sensitivity.

twist.text: Many people plateau at 'acceptance' â€” tolerating difference without adapting.

climax.text: Global competence is a lifelong practice, not a destination. Every culture teaches you something new about your own.

punchline.text: The more cultures you understand, the better you understand yourself.

quiz.question: What are the three pillars of intercultural competence?
